title: LME aluminium eases to $2,854/t as Asian 3-month price rises $32/t
summary: On December 3, 2025, London Metal Exchange (LME) aluminium prices slightly declined to $2,854 per tonne, down about 0.2% from the previous day. However, the 3-month Asian Reference Price increased by $32 per tonne (1.1%) to $2,897 per tonne. LME inventories also saw a small decline in stock and cancelled warrants.

title: Aluminum rose to 2,901.50 USD/T on December 3, 2025, up 1.36% from the previous day
summary: Aluminum prices rebounded from a near one-month low to $2,901.50 per tonne on December 3, 2025, up 1.36% from the previous day. The price has risen about 1.05% over the past month and nearly 9.4% year-over-year, supported by macroeconomic tailwinds including expectations of Fed rate cuts and stimulus signals from Beijing.

title: Aluminum premium reaches record high in the US due to tariffs and global squeeze
summary: The US Midwest aluminum premium reached a record 88.10 cents per pound ($1,942 per metric ton) due to tariffs and supply constraints. This premium, added to the global benchmark price, has driven US aluminum prices significantly higher, reflecting tight inventories and import reductions.

title: Alcoa says high US aluminum prices offset Trump tariff costs
summary: Alcoa reported that despite $69 million in additional costs from US tariffs on Canadian aluminum imports, higher domestic aluminum prices have offset these tariff impacts. The US Midwest premium has surged 113% since June, driven by declining inventories and reduced imports, with tariff costs expected to rise further in the current quarter.

title: Aluminum Prices Hit 3-Year High: Is It the Next Key Metal in the Clean Energy Shift?
summary: Aluminum prices have surged to a 3-year high around $2,800 per tonne, driven by rising demand from electric vehicles, solar, and grid upgrades amid supply constraints. Factors include China's power shortages, environmental production limits, and supply risks from Guinea. Low-carbon aluminum commands a premium, reflecting growing demand for sustainable materials in clean energy sectors.

title: SMM Flash News: Domestic Secondary Aluminum Ingot Inventory Drops 335 mt WoW to 55,300 mt on Dec 4
summary: Domestic secondary aluminum ingot inventories in China dropped by 335 metric tons week-over-week to 55,300 metric tons as of December 4, 2025. Prices are expected to fluctuate narrowly at high levels in the short term, with market attention on improvements in aluminum scrap supply.

title: SMM Flash News: Domestic Secondary Aluminum Ingot Inventory Drops 335 mt WoW to 55,300 mt on Dec 4
summary: Domestic secondary aluminum ingot inventory in China dropped by 335 metric tons week-on-week to 55,300 metric tons on December 4, 2025. The decline reflects ongoing tight supply conditions and continued demand resilience in the aluminum market.

title: Expectations for Interest Rate Cuts Heat Up Combined with Demand Resilience SHFE Aluminum and LME Aluminum Strengthen Simultaneously [SMM Aluminum Morning Meeting Minutes]
summary: Aluminum prices strengthened in early December amid expectations for interest rate cuts and resilient demand. Supply constraints and low industry inventory continue to support prices, with limited downside risk and cautious optimism for further gains if demand improves.

title: Aluminum - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News - Trading Economics
summary: Aluminum prices rose to 2,901.50 USD/ton on December 3, 2025, up 1.36% from the previous day. Supply pressures persist due to production curbs in China, setbacks in new smelter projects, and operational disruptions in Iceland and Australia.

title: China's steel prices set to strengthen in December
summary: Chinese steel prices are expected to move upward in December, driven by improved macroeconomic conditions and recovery in market fundamentals. China's national composite steel price ended November at Yuan 3,453/tonne ($488/t), with steelmakers reducing production to support prices. Positive global liquidity and potential Federal Reserve rate cuts are expected to provide additional support for commodity prices.

title: December Steel Price Outlook: Macro & Fundamental Drivers
summary: Steel prices are expected to experience limited upside in December despite rising macro expectations, with focus on hot-rolled coil futures at 3,230–3,330. The supply-demand imbalance remains relatively limited, with continued inventory declines but persistent destocking pressure for sheets and plates. Market attention is centered on upcoming domestic policy meetings regarding real estate stabilization and domestic demand expansion.

title: HRC Steel Rises to 906 USD/T
summary: Hot-Rolled Coil (HRC) steel rose to 906 USD/T on December 3, 2025, up 0.55% from the previous day. Over the past month, HRC steel has risen 6.84%, and is up 32.07% compared to the same time last year. The price remains well below its all-time high of 1,945 USD/T reached in September 2021.

title: Price gap between US HRC, imports shrinks
summary: The price gap between US-produced hot-rolled coil and imported steel has narrowed to its lowest level since summer, with US HRC averaging $895/st. After accounting for 50% tariffs and import costs, Asian HRC delivers at approximately $750/st, creating a $145/st premium for domestic steel. The tariff policy implemented by President Trump continues to significantly impact the competitive landscape between domestic and imported steel.

title: China's steel prices set to strengthen in December
summary: Chinese steel prices are expected to rise in December due to an improved macroeconomic environment. Despite production cuts and furnace idling in North China to ease air pollution, steel demand remains resilient, leading to shrinking steel supply and falling inventories across China.

title: Price gap between US HRC, imports shrinks
summary: The price gap between US hot rolled coil (HRC) steel and imported steel has narrowed to its lowest since summer 2025. US domestic HRC remains more expensive than imports from Asia and Europe after tariffs and import costs, but the difference has decreased significantly, influenced by Section 232 tariffs and lead times.

title: Japan's JFE to buy 50% in Bhushan's steel business
summary: Japan's JFE Steel plans to acquire a 50% stake in Bhushan Power & Steel, aiming to increase JSW Kalinga's steel production capacity to 10 million tons. The deal, expected to conclude by mid-2026, supports expansion plans leveraging existing land and aims to boost production and profitability.

title: Integrated Steel Plant Joint Venture with JSW Steel in India
summary: JFE Steel and JSW Steel's joint venture plans to expand crude steel production at their integrated steelworks in India to 10 million tons by 2030, with potential to increase to 15 million tons. The JV aims to combine JFE's technology with JSW's operational strengths to capture growing Indian steel demand and improve productivity.

title: ArcelorMittal launches new €500 million electric steel production line in France
summary: ArcelorMittal has inaugurated a new €500 million electric steel production line in France, capable of producing 155,000 tons of electric steel annually. This facility targets automotive and industrial sectors, supporting the transition to greener steel production.

title: Japan's Steel Sector Needs to Use All Low-Carbon Pathways to Reach Emissions Goal
summary: Japan's steel industry, responsible for 13% of national emissions, must adopt multiple low-carbon technologies to meet its 2050 net-zero target. Scrap-based electric arc furnaces powered by renewable energy offer a cost-effective emissions reduction path by 2030, while hydrogen and carbon capture remain more expensive.

title: Fortescue and TISCO join forces on green ironmaking technology trial
summary: Fortescue Metals Group and Taiyuan Iron and Steel (TISCO) have partnered to trial green ironmaking technology, aiming to reduce carbon emissions in steel production. This collaboration reflects growing industry efforts to develop sustainable steelmaking processes.

title: Copper Hits Record High on LME Surge
summary: Copper prices surged to a new record high, driven by a surge in requests to withdraw metal from London Metal Exchange warehouses, mainly fueled by demand in Asia. Prices exceeded $11,400 per tonne, surpassing previous peaks and highlighting ongoing supply tightness.

title: Copper Hits Record High on Supply Concerns and Weaker Dollar
summary: Copper prices advanced to a record high, rising 0.7% to $14,895, supported by supply concerns and a weaker US dollar. The market remains tight, with ongoing worries about global supply constraints.

title: US November ADP Employment Unexpectedly Declines, LME Copper Surges Overnight
summary: LME copper prices surged overnight, closing at $11,448.5 per tonne, up 2.72%, amid a surprise decline in US ADP employment and comments from Treasury Secretary Yellen on interest rate cuts. Glencore's downward revision of copper production forecasts further intensified supply concerns.

title: Copper Price Sets New Record in London
summary: Copper futures on the LME jumped as much as 2.6% to over $11,400 per tonne, setting a new record amid a spike in warehouse withdrawals and concerns of a global supply squeeze. Traders are ramping up shipments to American ports as US futures surge.

title: Unreleased SMM Metal Production Data for October 2025
summary: China's copper cathode production in October 2025 decreased by 29,400 metric tons month-on-month (2.62%) but increased 9.63% year-on-year, with a cumulative increase of 11.96% for the year. The decline was mainly due to maintenance at eight smelters affecting 2.2 million mt of smelting capacity. Production is expected to slightly decrease in November but may recover somewhat in December despite high copper prices limiting output incentives.

title: Copper reaches record highs on concerns about supply and a weaker dollar
summary: Glencore and Chilean state-owned copper producer Codelco signed a preliminary agreement to collaborate on a new smelter in Antofagasta, Chile, with a processing capacity of about 1.5 million tons per year. Codelco will supply up to 800,000 metric tons of copper concentrate annually for at least ten years. This project aims to increase Chile's smelting capacity, strengthen sovereignty, and improve logistical efficiency.

title: Copper prices rise on concerns about supply; Fed rate decision pending
summary: Copper prices surged amid supply concerns and expectations of a Federal Reserve interest rate cut. The partnership between Codelco and Glencore to build a smelter in Chile was highlighted, with the smelter expected to process 1.5 million tons per year and improve Chile's copper smelting capabilities, which currently represent only 6% of global capacity.

title: Amerigo's Minera Valle Central Receives Prestigious 2025 Circular Awards in Chile
summary: Amerigo's Minera Valle Central (MVC) was awarded for its Energy and Environmental Liabilities Transformation project, which recovers copper and molybdenum from tailings, improves energy efficiency, and applies circular economy principles. This project reduces energy consumption, emissions, and natural resource use by converting tailings from Codelco's El Teniente mine into valuable production inputs using advanced technology and operational optimizations.

title: Copper supply crunch threatens energy and digital transitions
summary: UNCTAD warns that a looming copper shortfall could stall global green and digital transitions due to surging demand and supply challenges like declining ore grades and geopolitical tensions. Recycling currently supplies 20% of refined copper and is critical to meeting demand, especially for developing countries aiming to reduce import dependence and emissions.

title: BHP's Copper Boom: Sustainable Mining to Meet Soaring Global Demand
summary: BHP reported record copper production, reaching 2,017 thousand tonnes, an 8% increase from last year, driven by operational synergies and sustainability efforts. The company aims to reduce greenhouse gas emissions by 30% by 2030 and achieve net zero by 2050, aligning copper production with the global energy transition and digital infrastructure growth.

title: Copper Smashes Records as Supply Fears Intensify Amidst LME Withdrawal Surge
summary: Copper futures surged over 2.6% on the London Metal Exchange due to supply fears amid accelerating electrification and decarbonization demands. The industry faces challenges like declining ore grades and ESG pressures, making innovation in mining technology and recycling critical to sustaining supply and supporting the green economy transition.

title: Merdeka's Commitment to the Environment and Energy Resilience
summary: Merdeka demonstrated its sustainability commitment at the 2025 WED Exhibition by supporting the clean energy transition through responsible mining of critical metals like copper. The company emphasizes its role in enabling renewable energy technologies and electric vehicle batteries, contributing to energy resilience and environmental preservation.

title: Vale, Glencore to jointly assess copper development project in Sudbury Basin
summary: Vale and Glencore plan to form a joint venture to develop a copper project in the Sudbury Basin, expected to produce 880,000 tonnes of copper over 21 years. The project also includes nickel, cobalt, gold, and other critical minerals, addressing supply challenges amid declining copper output and ore grades.

title: [SMM Nickel Midday Review] Nickel prices rose slightly on December 3
summary: Nickel prices increased slightly on December 3, with the SMM #1 refined nickel price averaging 120,000 yuan/mt, up 100 yuan/mt from the previous day. Despite short-term fluctuations, nickel prices face long-term pressure amid expectations of a US Fed interest rate cut and subdued manufacturing data. The most-traded SHFE nickel contract fluctuated between 114,000-118,000 yuan/mt.

title: Nickel price hits 4-year low as gloom offsets potential Indonesia cuts
summary: Nickel prices fell 1.8% to $15,235 per ton on the LME, reaching a four-year low due to a weak outlook from the Federal Reserve despite potential mining quota cuts in Indonesia. Indonesia is considering reducing nickel ore mining quotas sharply from 272 million tons in 2025 to 150 million tons in 2026 to support prices. The metal has declined about 8% this year, pressured by new supply and slowing electric vehicle sales.

title: Outlook for the Nickel Industry in the 15th Five-Year Plan Period
summary: The global nickel market is experiencing structural oversupply driven by increased low-cost secondary nickel supply from Indonesia and weak downstream demand, especially in stainless steel. The industry is shifting focus from scale to high-quality development emphasizing technology, cost efficiency, and sustainability. Nickel prices on December 4 were benchmarked at 120,433.33 RMB/ton, slightly up from earlier in the month.

title: On December 4, the SMM #1 refined nickel price stood at 117,700–123,100 yuan/mt
summary: The SMM #1 refined nickel price on December 4 averaged 120,400 yuan/mt, rising 400 yuan/mt from the previous day. This reflects a modest price recovery amid ongoing market volatility and supply-demand imbalances in the nickel market.

title: Indonesia's Nickel Supply & The Global Price Slump - What the Market Sell-Off Signals for Investors
summary: Nickel prices have fallen to around $14,550 per tonne, near a four-year low, due to oversupply from Indonesia's refinery expansion despite announced mining quota cuts. LME inventories surged by 90,000 tonnes in 2025, reinforcing bearish price momentum. While EV battery demand offers long-term support, current excess supply and weak stainless steel demand keep prices depressed.

title: Nickel fell to 14,873 USD/T on December 4, 2025
summary: Nickel prices declined 0.18% to $14,873 per tonne on December 4, 2025, continuing a downward trend with prices down 0.95% over the past month and 6.82% year-over-year. The Indonesian government announced new rules restricting nickel refining permits to refiners producing intermediate products, as markets reassess the magnitude of global oversupply.

title: SMM #1 refined nickel price update
summary: On December 4, the SMM #1 refined nickel price stood at 117,700–123,100 yuan/mt, with an average price of 120,400 yuan/mt, up 400 yuan/mt from the previous day. This reflects modest daily gains in the Chinese refined nickel market.

title: Proposal for global minerals deal meets opposition as China looks away
summary: A proposal for a global minerals deal is facing opposition as China distances itself from the initiative. The article discusses geopolitical tensions surrounding critical minerals negotiations, with Saudi Arabia, Iran, and Russia also involved in the discussions.

title: Tenaris remains profitable in 2025
summary: Tenaris reported a $37 million profit in Q3 2025, a 15.6% increase from the previous quarter but a 22.9% decrease compared to Q3 2024. Sales in North American oil and gas tubular products remained steady, despite some tariff increases on steel imports affecting costs and margins. The company expects sales to stay close to Q3 levels but anticipates margin pressure from higher tariffs.

title: Tenaris Announces 2025 Third Quarter Results
summary: Tenaris reported stable sales of tubular products in Q3 2025, with steady activity from Rig Direct customers in the US and Canada and some shipment acceleration in the Middle East. However, sales in Argentina's fracking and coiled tubing services were temporarily affected. The company noted that increased US steel tariffs have reduced imports but prices have not yet fully reflected tariff costs. Sales volumes showed a slight decrease in seamless pipes but an increase in welded pipes.

title: Tenaris reduced pipe sales to 2.95 million tons in January-September
summary: Tenaris sold 2.95 million tons of pipe products in the first nine months of 2025, marking a 2% decrease compared to the same period in 2024. This reduction reflects a slight decline in overall sales volumes amid challenging market conditions.

title: Edison Energia, Prysmian in 150MW Italy Solar PV PPA
summary: Edison Energia has signed a multi-year power purchase agreement (PPA) with Prysmian for 150MWp of solar PV power from a plant in central Italy. The deal will supply about 25% of Prysmian's annual electricity consumption in Italy and is part of its strategy to secure renewable energy and stable costs.

title: Prysmian Honored at AmCham's Transatlantic Award Gala Dinner for Its Investment in Encore Wire
summary: Prysmian was recognized at the AmCham Transatlantic Award Gala Dinner for its investment in Encore Wire, highlighting its commitment to strengthening the US cable supply chain and its global expansion in copper cable manufacturing.
